profiles: Summary After 18-years working in high-tech as a Computer Engineer, I took a few years to enjoy living aboard a sailboat while traveling through the Caribbean with my family. I thoroughly enjoyed the challenge during those years of home schooling our two children. Since returning to life on land, I've held board positions in two different youth-serving organizations. Currently, I am tutoring upper grades and college students in math -- subjects including College Math, Algebra I, Geometry, Algebra II, and Pre-Calculus plus SAT /ACT test prep. Experience Math Tutor Self Employed October 2009  – Present (5 years 11 months) Palm City, Florida Subject-area homework and test-prep help, but beyond that I work one-on-one with students to facilitate true understanding math concepts, focused on individual abilities and needs, preparing the way for success in all future math classes. Algebra, Geometry, Trigonometry, Pre-Calculus, College Math. Sales & Marketing Engineer Intel Corporation August 1986  –  May 1998  (11 years 10 months) Responsible for strategic account relationships including IBM and Microsoft. Summary Recently graduated from Portland State University with a BS in Electrical Engineering. Currently employment at Intel Corporation as a Sales and Marketing Engineer in Santa Clara, California. Experience Sales and Marketing Engineer Intel Corporation August 2015  – Present (1 month) Santa Clara, California Intern Intel Corporation April 2013  –  February 2014  (11 months) Hillsboro, Oregon •	Debugging and triaging customer issues on Intel’s key small business platform and software product, Intel® Small Business Advantage (SBA) along with supporting the release of 7 hotfixes. 
•	Created collateral such as how-to videos localized in Chinese, Portuguese, and Spanish for field and customer enablement. 
•	Evaluated the feasibility of transitioning from desktops to 2 in 1 portable touch devices with Windows 8 within a small business by planning, conducting, supporting, and documenting a 4 month pilot. My report was rolled up to the business group general manager and received high attention and praise. 
•	Initiated, designed, built, and programmed a very successful demo of Intel® SBA’s USB blocker feature, also used as a contest at multiple company conferences. 
•	Built flash demo for Location Based Services used for an executive keynote presentation at an international conference. 
•	Technical support for the organization and for Intel® Identity Protection Technology testing on the Microsoft Surface Pro platform. 
•	Assembled and configured numerous Windows based desktop systems for testing with Intel® Setup and Configuration Software, Intel® Small Business Advantage, Intel® vPro, and various security software and hardware. Summary Growing up, I was always fascinated by technology. One of the very earliest things I remember asking for was a computer, and from that point on that was my passion. I loved seeing the latest gadgets and devices and seeing how they worked and seeing what vision each exciting new startup had for the world. 
 
So naturally, my path as an electrical and computer engineer was already set for college. But as I started down that path, I realized there was another piece of the puzzle that left me wanting more than just the engineering side: people. It was during a senior design project when I realized that, though I loved engineering, what I found even more passion in was working with and partnering with people to accomplish goals together. 
 
From that point on, I knew I wanted to understand more about the business side and use that as a strength as well. I continued on to get a Masters of Engineering and an MBA. During my time in business school, I made it a point to focus on classes that revolved around people and relationships, such as negotiations and organizational behavior.  
 
As a result, I came away with an enormous passion for developing collaborative relationships and partnerships. Creating customer value isn't just a buzz phrase for me, but a key philosophical belief in how I approach all relationships. Summary Growing up, I was always fascinated by technology.
